pr_title: Add map-data Java Model (add map-data subproject with POJOs)

timeline.message:
Add map-data Java Model (add map-data subproject with POJOs)

This update adds model objects that can work with the 'xml-reader' library
and be instantiated via the XmlMapper (in 'xml-reader').  The model
objects are meant to strictly represent what is in the XML files without
any further interpretation of the data. Once these objects are loaded
from an XML we'll then need to go through an "assembly" process (future
work) to convert these objects into a 'GameData'.

timeline.bodyText:
Didn't expect this ^^
Are you planning to migrate some of the existing project to use this plugin, or just for this particular project?
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: No plans per-say. There was recently (now removed) a reader class in map-data whereby you'd always need the xml-reader sub-project. Now that is removed and map-data and xml-reader are (kinda) decoupled. At this point having this as a java-library does not quite make as much sense. With that said, there are places where I think it would be of benefit to use java-library, notably anywhere if you use one dependency import then you would always need another.
replies.author: DanVanAtta
